basics.name: Vitor Muzzi Magalhaes
basics.label: Platform/DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Extensive experience in setting up and managing cloud enterprise infrastructure following industry best practices. Experience in technology enablement across different practices and industries. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills combined with a strategic mindset to drive innovation and optimize processes. Excellent interpersonal qualities and ability to create meaningful team work and collaboration. Seeking challenging opportunities to leverage my diverse skill set in a dynamic and growth-oriented environment.

work.name: Slalom Consulting
work.summary: Consulting services for cloud enablement and DevOps engineering. Working directly with clients to design solutions that allow them to innovate and to improve their development cycle following the DevOps philosophy.
highlights:
AWS Landing Zone for Mission-Critical Aerospace applications:
‣ Leading a platform engineering team in developing CI/CD pipelines for deploying and configuring OpenShift clusters on AWS through Terraform.
‣ Assisting in the creation of a hub-and-spoke network topology spanning multiple AWS accounts following network engineering best practices.
Impact: creation of a robust landing zone on AWS for a multi-billion dollar aerospace company following their acquisition of another company’s airline product portfolio.

Policy as Code on Azure:
‣ Working closely with security team of a major aerospace enterprise to establish security priorities for Azure governance.
‣ Writing declarative code that defines the desired state of their security policies using Enterprise Azure Policy as Code (EPAC) solution.
‣ Transferring knowledge to security team to take ownership of the solution.
Impact: providing the tools and knowledge for the security team to create policies and guardrails for managing multiple Azure subscriptions.

Adopting DevOps practices for Modern Data Platform
‣ Deploying self-hosted Azure Pipelines agents on Virtual Machine Scale Sets greatly improving performance, security and cost optimization for pipeline executions.
‣ Designing Terraform modules for deploying Databricks clusters and jobs to be used by data engineers.
Impact: close to $5000 in monthly savings with the self-hosted agents. Enabling data engineers by adopting infrastructure as code to manage their resources.

work.name: Freelance Consulting
work.summary: Helped architect cloud solutions as well as setup and manage accounts/applications across different cloud providers. Enthusiast about working with new infrastructure technologies and improving workflows/deployment cycles, troubleshooting and implementing best practices.
highlights: Helping a foreign university adopt Google Cloud Platform by setting up their organization, billing and IAM resources.
Self-hosting an open-source ERP suite on Google Cloud Platform to manage university operations.
Impact: replacing an on-premises system that constantly had outages with a highly available ERP deployed on GCP.
